intro: Gymnadenia gracilis, commonly known as the slender gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are slender and often branched. Gymnadenia gracilis is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
